meanings.definition: The quality or state of being newsworthy.
meanings.sent1: The newsiness of the story made it to the front page of the newspaper.
meanings.sent2: The journalist evaluated the newsiness of each event before deciding what to report.
meanings.sent3: The newsiness of the cat chasing its tail was surprisingly captivating.
meanings.sent4: The newsiness of the situation was like a bright spotlight on the otherwise dull day.
meanings.sent5: The newsiness of the crime scene was etched into the minds of the witnesses.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of resembling or having the qualities of news.
meanings.sent1: Her blog posts lacked newsiness, so they didn't attract many readers.
meanings.sent2: The movie had a certain newsiness that kept the audience engaged throughout.
meanings.sent3: The newsiness of the gossip made it spread like wildfire through the town.
meanings.sent4: The newsiness of the rumor mill was like a never-ending cycle of drama.
meanings.sent5: The newsiness of the fashion show drew in crowds from all over the city.

meanings.definition: The quality of being suitable for or characteristic of news.
meanings.sent1: The newsiness of the press release ensured it would be picked up by major media outlets.
meanings.sent2: The politician's speech lacked newsiness, so it didn't make headlines.
meanings.sent3: The newsiness of the weather report made it more interesting than usual.
meanings.sent4: The newsiness of the discovery sparked excitement among the scientific community.
meanings.sent5: The newsiness of the celebrity scandal overshadowed all other stories that day.
